segment.source: Device Guard signing (Windows 10)
segment.target: Device Guard signing (Windows 10)

segment.source: Device Guard signing is a Device Guard feature that is available in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Device Guard signing is a Device Guard feature that is available in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Device Guard signing
segment.target: Device Guard signing

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Device Guard signing is a Device Guard feature that is available in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Device Guard signing is a Device Guard feature that is available in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: It gives admins a single place to sign catalog files and code integrity policies.
segment.target: It gives admins a single place to sign catalog files and code integrity policies.

segment.source: After admins have created catalog files for unsigned apps and signed the catalog files, they can add the signers to a code integrity policy.
segment.target: After admins have created catalog files for unsigned apps and signed the catalog files, they can add the signers to a code integrity policy.

segment.source: You can merge the code integrity policy with your existing policy to include your custom signing certificate.
segment.target: You can merge the code integrity policy with your existing policy to include your custom signing certificate.

segment.source: This allows you to trust the catalog files.
segment.target: This allows you to trust the catalog files.

segment.source: Device Guard is a feature set that consists of both hardware and software system integrity hardening features.
segment.target: Device Guard is a feature set that consists of both hardware and software system integrity hardening features.

segment.source: These features use new virtualization-based security options and the trust-nothing mobile device operating system model.
segment.target: These features use new virtualization-based security options and the trust-nothing mobile device operating system model.

segment.source: A key feature in this model is called configurable code integrity, which allows your organization to choose exactly which software or trusted software publishers are allowed to run code on your client machines.
segment.target: A key feature in this model is called configurable code integrity, which allows your organization to choose exactly which software or trusted software publishers are allowed to run code on your client machines.

segment.source: Also, Device Guard offers organizations a way to sign existing line-of-business (LOB) applications so that they can trust their own code, without the requirement that the application be repackaged.
segment.target: Also, Device Guard offers organizations a way to sign existing line-of-business (LOB) applications so that they can trust their own code, without the requirement that the application be repackaged.

segment.source: Also, this same method of signing allows organizations to trust individual third-party applications.
segment.target: Also, this same method of signing allows organizations to trust individual third-party applications.

segment.source: For more information, see Device Guard deployment guide.
segment.target: For more information, see Device Guard deployment guide.

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Add unsigned app to code integrity policy
segment.target: Add unsigned app to code integrity policy

segment.source: When you want to add an unsigned app to a code integrity policy, you need to start with a code integrity policy created from a reference device.
segment.target: When you want to add an unsigned app to a code integrity policy, you need to start with a code integrity policy created from a reference device.

segment.source: Then, create the catalog files for your unsigned app, sign the catalog files, and then merge the default policy that includes your signing certificate with existing code integrity policies.
segment.target: Then, create the catalog files for your unsigned app, sign the catalog files, and then merge the default policy that includes your signing certificate with existing code integrity policies.

segment.source: Sign code integrity policy with Device Guard signing
segment.target: Sign code integrity policy with Device Guard signing

segment.source: Signing code integrity policies prevents policies from being tampered with after they're deployed.
segment.target: Signing code integrity policies prevents policies from being tampered with after they're deployed.

segment.source: You can sign code integrity policies with the Device Guard signing portal.
segment.target: You can sign code integrity policies with the Device Guard signing portal.

segment.source: File and size limits
segment.target: File and size limits

segment.source: When you're uploading files for Device Guard signing, there are a few limits for files and file size:
segment.target: When you're uploading files for Device Guard signing, there are a few limits for files and file size:

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Limit
segment.target: Limit

segment.source: Maximum size for a policy or catalog file
segment.target: Maximum size for a policy or catalog file

segment.source: 3.5 MB
segment.target: 3.5 MB

segment.source: Maximum size for multiple files (uploaded in a group)
segment.target: Maximum size for multiple files (uploaded in a group)

segment.source: 4 MB
segment.target: 4 MB

segment.source: Maximum number of files per upload
segment.target: Maximum number of files per upload

segment.source: 15 files
segment.target: 15 files

segment.target: File types

segment.target: Catalog and policy files have required files types.

segment.source: File
segment.target: File

segment.source: Required file type
segment.target: Required file type

segment.source: catalog files
segment.target: catalog files

segment.target: .cat

segment.source: policy files
segment.target: policy files

segment.source: .bin
segment.target: .bin

segment.source: Store for Business roles and permissions
segment.target: Store for Business roles and permissions

segment.source: Signing code integrity policies and access to Device Guard portal requires the Device Guard signer role.
segment.target: Signing code integrity policies and access to Device Guard portal requires the Device Guard signer role.

segment.source: Device Guard signing certificates
segment.target: Device Guard signing certificates

segment.source: All certificates generated by the Device Guard signing service are unique per customer and are independent of the Microsoft production code signing certificate authorities.
segment.target: All certificates generated by the Device Guard signing service are unique per customer and are independent of the Microsoft production code signing certificate authorities.

segment.source: All Certification Authority (CA) keys are stored within the cryptographic boundary of Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) publication 140-2 compliant hardware security modules.
segment.target: All Certification Authority (CA) keys are stored within the cryptographic boundary of Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) publication 140-2 compliant hardware security modules.

segment.source: After initial generation, root certificate keys and top level CA keys are removed from the online signing service, encrypted, and stored offline.
segment.target: After initial generation, root certificate keys and top level CA keys are removed from the online signing service, encrypted, and stored offline.
